result.execSummary:
The defendant Walter D Miller was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Child Abuse-Recklessly Cause Great Harm, a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.03(3)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay costs of the action. Pay supervision fees as ordered by Dept. of Corrections. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
No unsupervised contact with children under age 18 without DOC consent. Wife cannot be supervisor.
Submit DNA sample. Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment.

timeConds.notes: 3 months of sentence are stayed to be used at discretion of Court through petition by DOC. Huber privileges granted. 60 days to report. Court will allow Defendant to serve sentence in 3 month segments with entire sentence to be completed within 3 years. Can be served in any county. Defendant is responsible for notifying Door County Jail if sentence is being served in different county.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Walter D Miller

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: for Sentence Modification - Defendant requesting furlough. Per Court, approved. 48 hour request for furlough approved (for birth). Jail to determine appropriate start time. (State not objecting. P.O. hasn't responded.)

Defendant Walter D Miller in court with attorney Steven G. Richards. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews charge, max. penalties, receipt of PSI, recommendation contained therein.  State makes statement regarding inadequacy of PSI. State/Defense make sentencing recommendations (not joint). Employer makes statement. Defendant makes statement. Court finds PSI woefully inadequate, makes statement regarding sentencing. Bond no longer in effect.

ADDRESS INFO for Walter D Miller
Current: N6711 STH 42, Lot 9, Algoma, WI 54201 United States  (Effective: 01-26-2015)
Prior: 11103 Aries Drive, Orlando, FL 32837 United States

Defendant Walter D Miller in court with attorney Steven G. Richards. Ray Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews charge, max. penalties, elements. Defendant enters no contest plea. Court questions Defendant on rights, finds plea made freely and voluntarily, accepts plea, and finds Defendant guilty. Court reviews collateral consequences of felony conviction, possible penalties. Counsel request PSI. Court orders PSI. Bond continues as is. State advises of modification of offer.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 7, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Walter D Miller appeared by phone from Georgia. Attorney Steven G. Richards appeared in Court. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense requests that case be set for plea hearing in early January, advises of counseling that Defendant is undergoing, needs time to discuss matter with DA Pelrine.  Plea hearing scheduled for January 26, 2015 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Walter D Miller appeared by phone. Attorney Steven G. Richards appeared in Court. Raymond L. Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews previous activity. Defense advises of receipt of discovery, Defendant's change of employment, anticipates resolution/possible plea, requests for status in about 60 days.  Status conference scheduled for November 24, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Walter D Miller and attorney Steven G. Richards appeared by phone. Raymond L. Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense waives reading of Information, enters not guilty plea. Defense requests status in 60-90 days. Bond continues as is.  Status conference scheduled for September 29, 2014 at 10:00 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Walter D Miller
Current: 11103 Aries Drive, Orlando, FL 32837 United States  (Effective: 06-05-2014)
Prior: 765 Mill Rd, Sturgeon Bay, WI 54235

Defendant Walter D Miller in court with attorney Steven G Richards.  Joan M Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense advises that Defendant will waive prelim.  Court questions Defendant, finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver and binds Defendant over for trial. State will file Information and Discovery Demand later today. Defense requests arraignment be scheduled, requests that Defendant be allowed to appear by phone if necessary.  Bond continues as is.  Arraignment scheduled for July 14, 2014 at 03:30 pm.
No contact direct or indirect with CCM or residence where C.C.M. resides.

Defendant Walter D Miller in court. Joan M Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews charges, max. penalties, right to counsel, right to prelim. Defendant is getting an attorney, hopes to have one by the end of the day.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 5, 2014 at 10:30 am.  

Case called again at 11:06. Defendant presents Petition for Appointment of Counsel. Court questions Defendant on income, expenses. Court denies Petition, thinks Defendant should be able to afford an attorney with his earnings. Defendant can't save a retainer. Court suggests that Defendant call some attorneys to see what he can work out.
